direction.raw_text: (cont'd) She cook for him, fixed him up all kinds of nice new clothes, kept him in gin and poker chips-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't see no problem with that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, come four, five months, a man starts to- sorry, China Doll, but this just the way it is- a man gots needs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nadine look like she can take care of those, too-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You eat chicken every morning, noon and night for five months, you get a taste for some different kind of meat, right? (looks to China Doll) Maybe I shouldn't be-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aint gonna tell me something I haven't heard worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Nappy goes out and has him a- a porkchop or two, let's say- and he comes back from Toussaint's one night feeling no pain, smelling like- like porkchops- the way a man will- and he falls out on Nadine's couch and commences to snore. Wake up the next mornin, finds she had took all his clothes off without him knowin it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man was dog drunk-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Nadine come in with a skillet in her hand, hot grits bubbling in it, says "Baby, I got your breakfast." "Not this morning, Nadine," he says, sittin up, "don't think I could eat a thing." "Well then," she says, "we can't let this go to waste, can we?" and she dump that whole hot bubblin mess right in the man's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wincing)    Owwww!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she got busy with that hot iron on his head. Screams didn't bring the neighbors in, she would of killed that man. They are all quiet for a moment, contemplating-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to admit it, though- woman is an artist with that Singer machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scuse me? They turn to see Sonny standing in the doorway-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one of you is Mr. Pinetop? Ty's eyes fix on Sonny's face for a moment- something familiar there- then go down to the guitar case at his feet-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We aint hirin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can play anything- Ty indicates the Guitar Sam POSTER hanging behind the bar-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Already got me a professional. Sonny looks a little shaky-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guitar Sam really coming all the way out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That so surprising?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no-- uhm, Mr. Shack Thomas said that if I was to-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Shack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We uh- we travelled together- Ty gives him a once-over-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When's the last time you ate solid food, young man? Sonny has to think-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to China Doll) Take him back and fix him somethin, China Doll. Standin there all hungry-eyed, puts me off my breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's real kind of you- Sonny pulls his hat off as he follows China Doll, who is suddenly quiet and self-conscious, back to the kitchen-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must of come in on the northbound last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look like he got cooties, too. Straw in them boxcars is full of em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never cared to travel that way. Ty grows somber, reminiscing-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was out there ridin them rails between the wars. Seem like half the country headin west rolled past the other half comin back east. (musing) Every one of us scrapin for the next meal-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the place. They turn to see COOL BREEZE, a hard-looking, sharply-dressed character, leading the prosperous looking MR. SIMMONS into the club as if they aren't there-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yall can tear things down, put things up- got a lot of potential.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks bigger in here than it does from the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I help you gentlemen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just showing the man gonna run this place what he's got. Ty stands-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my place. A frozen moment.    Then Maceo stands as well, backing up his friend. Cool Breeze puts one foot up on the chair next to Ty, licks a finger and dabs at his shoeshine with it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You the piano player, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name's Tyrone- call me Pinetop Purvis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinetop Purvis who owes two hundred dollars to Lucky Hardaway up in Little Rock-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna get his-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinetop who missed last month's rent-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After this weekend-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After this weekend you gonna be the same raggedy-ass piano player can't pay his debts off and Mr. Simmons here gonna be the new proprietor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky give me two weeks-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky got a better offer. He nods toward Mr. Simmons-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't do that. Cool Breeze takes his foot down and gets up in Ty's face. He lets his jacket fall open so the butt of his .44 PISTOL is visible-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to defuse) What if we got our payment for him Monday? Cool Breeze doesn't take his eyes off Ty's-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saturday night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can do that-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not just a taste- the whole two hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I throw in a twenny-five cent tip for his messenger boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the meantime, we not open yet. Which means yall are trespassin. Cool Breeze grins, still locking eyeballs with Ty-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seen enough, Mr. Simmons?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe I have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cool Breeze breaks eye contact, strolls out, followed by Simmons-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, somebody could make something out of this place. Wouldn't take much work at all. Ty and Maceo wait till the men are gone before they speak-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We cleared over two hundred that one weekend-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple years back-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we didn't have no Louisiana guitar wizard playin neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, they say he draws em like flies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what they say. An awkward pause.   Both men are shaken.   Ty sits back down to think-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say first thing he does is go to the man that owns the joint, sticks out his hand and wants that cash money put in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already sent fifty to his manager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you payin him all out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd have to clear three hundred-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figure we charge folks two dollars to get in, then drinks-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) What I'm sayin is, less he sees the green up front the man won't get off the train. A TRUCK HORN honks outside-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that now? Ty, mind working, looks desperate as Maceo exits to see who's honking- 19   EXT. HONEYDRIPPER - MORNING                                 19 A battered TRUCK sits in front of the club. ZEKE, a taciturn white man, and his black loader step out as Maceo approaches-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calls out) Bout time you fellas run by. We just about dry here. The loader lets down the tailgate to reveal CASES OF BEER AND LIQUOR. He begins to pull them out and pile them on the ground-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your boss in? Maceo shouts back into the club-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrone!   Whiskey wagon come by! Ty steps out of the club carrying one of the Guitar Sam posters-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all a day late. Ty nods at the Ace of Spades club across the way-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Man Toussaint gonna chew you out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toussaint went over to another supplier upstate. We just got you, then we headin down to the army base, officers' club needs servicin. This fifty-six dollars-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weak grin) My credit no good anymore? Zeke only has to look at the loader, who starts to put the cases back onto the truck-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoah, whoah- what's your hurry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody that's right in his head sell liquor on credit. Specially not to no darktown roadhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well this is like a special case, see- we got the harvest coming in, soldiers at the base gonna be let out on leave- Saturday night. Aint enough hootch in this truck to satisfy what we gonna sell-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You pay as you go.   That's bidness. Zeke walks toward the cab of the truck, Ty following him, desperate, waving the poster-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can come by Monday, get paid and take back every damn drop I aint sold! We got Guitar Sam lined up, you know what that means?! Zeke steps in and slams the door, the loader doing the same on the other side of him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pay you extra- penny a bottle on the beer and a nickel on the whiskey! The truck engine coughs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (desperate) What if I throw in five dollars up front, just for you fellas- ? Zeke pulls away-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, man, everybody give credit, that's the American way! But the truck is gone down the road.   Maceo comes up beside Ty, watching forlornly-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we could buy some busthead from Willie Pettigrew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that sheriff sniffin around every night? Land my black ass in jail for good. Another TRUCK pulls around the bend from the opposite direction-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what we gonna do? The new truck slows to a stop by them.    The DRIVER pokes his head out-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a liquor delivery for a Mr. Lucien Toussaint?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would be me. Maceo bites his tongue.   Ty plays it through-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I trust they got my check all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't spose I'd be here if they didn't. Ty glances over to the Ace of Spades, then points behind the Honeydripper-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull it around to the back- we'll help you unload.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The driver nods and wheels the truck past them.   Maceo's smile fades and he looks to Ty-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, this better be some Saturday night. 20   INT. HONEYDRIPPER - KITCHEN - MORNING                         20 A little kitchen built onto the back of the bar. Sonny sits wolfing down eggs and toast as China Doll watches him from the stove-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arkansas.    How bout you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We come here just after Mama met my step-daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much happenin, little town like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) They started up the training base again-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been in the Army?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shoot people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fixed radios.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say this new war gonna be a short one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Might be, might not.    I was to Japan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? What's the people like there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holds a hand up) Bout that high. And they speak Japanese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been to California?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods)   Los Angeles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where they make the movies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go to the movies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I been once. He sits back and looks her over-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine-looking girl like you, ought to been all kinds of places.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to em. First I'm going to beauty school when Mama saves up the money and then I have a portable skill-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like playin music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My step-Daddy says that aint a skill-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -it's an affliction. Ty sticks his head in, Maceo behind him with a case of liquor in his arms-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, China Doll. Got some bidness in town you gonna help me with. Ty gives Sonny a distrustful look-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you, young man, want to point yourself west down that highway. Bout three miles you see a mess of people working in the fields- it's harvest time. If you can stoop and pull, they got a job for you. He steps out the back door-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And wash up them dishes before you go. 21   INT. MAYOR WINSHIP'S HOUSE - KITCHEN - MORNING            21 Delilah is washing breakfast dishes, SINGING a gospel song as she works-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see four and twenty elders Down on their knees I see four and twenty elders Down on their knees Well they all turn together Standing to greet the rising sun I see four and twenty elders Down on their knees AMANDA WINSHIP, the mayor's pretty, high-strung wife, enters and hovers uneasily-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your biscuits were wonderful this morning, Delilah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, they always are.   I don't know how you do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just cook em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I married Floyd I swear I couldn't even boil water. Might be why he insisted I needed help around the house. He used to come to the dinner table with a sense of dread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody can learn to cook. Just have to put your mind to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you could show me some of your secrets some time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No secrets to it. Imonna fix some ham with yams and greens today, you want to learn how. Amanda thinks about it, smiling all the while, sighs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe some other day. Delilah isn't surprised by the response-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just say the word, Miss Amanda, I have you cookin in no time. Amanda nods, uncomfortable but not leaving.   She can't exactly offer to help with the dishes-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just don't know what I'd do without you. 22   EXT. MAIN STREET - GENERAL STORE - MORNING                  22 Ty, Maceo and China Doll approach the general store.    A WHITE COUPLE enter from the front-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I need is for you to go get friendly with Luther, then I just happen in-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't just ask Mr. Skinner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Skinner don't want nothin from colored folks but they buy his goods and shine his shoes. You go on ahead, now- Maceo and China Doll cut around toward the back of the store. We TIGHTEN on Ty as he unrolls the posters he carries, looks across the street for another likely place to hang one-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was early Friday evenin Hounds began to bark Ty turns-   how did Possum get there, chair and all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stackolee an Billy Lyons Was squabblin In the dark Ty frowns at the lyrics-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stackolee said To Billy Lyons "What you think bout that? First you takes all my money Then you spits in My Stetson hat."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate that damn song. Possum keeps playing but stops singing-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you keepin, Tyrone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wary) Just tryin to hold it together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got your beautiful young daughter with you this mornin-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you be studyin her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heard you gone put on a guitar man out your place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you hear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grins)   Oh- the breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well this time the breeze know what it's blowin about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better be careful, Tyrone. You know what them guitar players are like. Ty glares at Possum-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful yourself. Ty stalks away around toward the back of the store.   Possum grins and sings again-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well he shot him Three times in the shoulder Three times in the side That was the last time he shot him Cause Poor Billy Up and died 23   EXT. REAR OF GENERAL STORE - MORNING                        23 A quartet of WORKMEN and DELIVERYMEN lounge on piled up shipping crates as Shack Thomas stands addressing them-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The time is ripe and the bill is past due. Roosevelt would of done it already, only he died and they don't listen to Miss Eleanor no more. But Mr. Truman startin to bend, specially now that we got a war heatin up. As Brother Randolph says-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here it comes-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Shack looks to see Ty joining the others-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -the gospel accordin to A. Phillip Randolph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pleased)    Tyrone! How you doing, man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got my nose above the waterline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here's my baby- how's your mama doing, China Doll? He gives China Doll a hug and kiss-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's doin fine, Uncle Shack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tellin the boys here how Brother Randolph pushin through this deal where our boys gonna be a full part of services- already got the Navy and the Air Force, and the Army is-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I carried a rifle in the Great War, Shack. Boys get in the middle of this Korea mess they aint gonna thank you for your efforts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want our due in this country, we got to go whole hog-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black folks shooting yellow folks to keep the white folks happy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's time to move on from that kind of thinkin. Ty starts in through the back entrance of the store-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go ahead and move right on, Shack. Then come back and tell the rest of us how it is. He steps in.   Shack turns to China Doll-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is a hard-headed man. 24   INT. GENERAL STORE - MORNING                              24 LUTHER, the head clerk, arranges boxes on the back wall and shoots a nervous look up front-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd have to ask Mr. Skinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you would. While you at it, remind him how one of the reasons colored folks come in here is to get the lowdown on what's happening in-- Luther brightens as China Doll steps in-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: China Doll! Luther is clearly smitten-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna let us put these posters up, aint you Luther?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh-- I don't think that be any problem at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beaming a smile) That's awful nice of you, Luther.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lookin special today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's sweet of you to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maceo, go on with the man and he show you where you can put em up. Come on, darlin, we got more stops to make- China Doll spreads a parting bit of sunshine-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to see you, Luther. Luther smiles and waves as Maceo hooks his arm and pulls him back into the store- 25   EXT. RAILROAD TRACKS/RESIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOOD - MORNING      25 Ty and China Doll hurry down the tracks and cross to the black side of town-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got that boy eatin out of your hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luther's the only one didn't pull my hair when he sit behind me at Sunday school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I hope you got a little that sugar left, cause we got to spread some on Miss Bertha Mae Spivey-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gone ask her to come sing again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imonna ask her for money. Word is she got a whole pile of it squirreled away. China Doll stops, breathing heavily, bends to put her hands on her knees-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, girl, we in a rush here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got to rest. Ty softens, walks back to stand beside her-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, baby.   You catch your breath. China Doll smiles weakly-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So- why Miss Spivey gonna give you money, you don't let her sing at the club any more?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gonna make her a partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Partner in what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the Honeydripper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But all you ever say it's just a hole you pour good money into-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That don't matter.     Imonna make her a proprietor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `tress'.   Like waiter and waitress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Proprietress. She got to like the sound of that. 26   EXT. MAIN STREET - GENERAL STORE - WINDOW, POSTER           26 One of the GUITAR SAM POSTERS appears in the front window as Maceo tapes it up- A trio on teenage girls stop to look at it as they pass (Possum is nowhere to be seen)- Maceo steps out to join them, eager to close the deal-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lovely ladies out to make a purchase-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That the same Guitar Sam is on the radio?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The very one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine lookin man. Real lady killer from what I hear. Got that New Orleans style to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ought to have a picture up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, we'll be gettin some of those when he comes in on the train. The main thing is, the man is electrified- and you know what that means. 27   EXT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE                                     27 Formerly a fairly grand house, Bertha Mae's hasn't been painted for awhile and the yard could use some work. Ty coaches China Doll as they climb the stairs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We make like we just come by to see how she's keepin, and then I'll kind of mention how I been thinking of bringing her on as a partner-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Left the door open. China Doll pushes the front door all the way open. We can hear Bertha Mae's VOICE singing on a scratchy old RECORD. China Doll peeks in to see-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 28   INT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE - FRONT PARLOR                         28 -Slick, sitting at the bottom of the STAIRS that lead to the second floor, looking lost and bewildered-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Ty frowns.    He was all geared up for the siege-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When she gonna be back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's just gone.   Woke up beside her and-- He can't go on, tears forming in his eyes.       China Doll and Ty trade a look- 29   INT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM                              29 We start on the RECORD PLAYER, needle down on the spinning song, then RACK to see Bertha Mae, laying DEAD in her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, damn. We RACK again as Ty and China Doll step in. Slick appears in the doorway behind them. He's been drinking-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fourteen years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: China Doll, you go find your Mama. She know how to fix up the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People make jokes and all, but I been with that woman fourteen years. That's a good part of my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And stop by Beauchamp's and tell em they got a customer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gimme the only home I ever had. He looks at them, devastated-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I'm gonna do now? 30   EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY                                     30 Sonny walking along. He has left his guitar and sack back at the club. He slows, seeing- POV - SHERIFF'S CAR The SHERIFF'S CAR is sitting at the side of the road, a COUNTRY SONG playing on the radio- SONNY He decides to brave it, walks ahead with his eyes fixed straight ahead. We he gets even with the car we see Sheriff Pugh sitting in the driver's seat, watching him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a hurry, boy? Sonny stops, looks to the Sheriff-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your hat off. Sonny takes his hat off. He meets the Sheriff's eyes, trying to strike a balance between defiant and submissive-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you headed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lookin for work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not from here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stranger wanderin around, no job- that would make you a vagrant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm lookin-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a job for you.   Get in the back. Sonny doesn't even think about running away. 31   EXT. 1ST COTTON FIELD - DAY - WORKERS                     31 Black PRISON LABORERS pick cotton, watched over by an armed DEPUTY- GATLIN (O.S.) I can always use another hand. We SHIFT to see GATLIN, a white planter who chews and spits tobacco, looking Sonny over as Sheriff Pugh stands by-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caught this young fella in flagrant violation of the statutes. Gawkery with intent to mope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he gonna run me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three dollars a day plus you feed im lunch. Now the sentence- that depends on how long you gonna need the help. Sonny decides to speak up-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get any trial?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you do, boy. And a speedy one, too. (points) Meet Judge Gatlin. Gatlin spits-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grab a sack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 32   EXT. PINEY WOODS - CROSSROADS - AFTERNOON                   32 Maceo nails a Guitar Sam POSTER to a tree, looks over his handiwork. An ARMY PLATOON trudges into the crossroads, sweat-soaked and footsore- Maceo watches, pleased, as the black soldiers check the poster out as they pass-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saturday night, fellas! Every fine- looking colored woman in the county gonna be there- don't want to miss it! A white LIEUTENANT passes, giving Maceo a dark look.   Maceo salutes-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Afternoon, sir.   Nice lookin bunch of soldiers. 33   INT. MAYOR WINFIELD'S HOUSE - DINING ROOM - DAY             33 Delilah sits at the dining room table with a sandwich she's made herself. We hear PERRY COMO on a RECORD somewhere in the house. She hasn't gotten two bites down before Amanda wanders in, crossing to the liquor cabinet-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh dear, I believe it's about that time- She pulls out a DECANTER OF WINE- AMANDA Would you care to join me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thank you. Amanda pours herself a glass of wine-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you won't join me, you don't partake. That was thoughtless of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you don't take spirits and- what else? In your church?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sort of between churches right now. I been thinking about changing over to the Holiness, but
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't been sanctified yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's been a minister in this week-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tent out by the fairgrounds. Delilah nods.   Amanda takes a drink-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The church I grew up in- we were Pentacostals- they wouldn't have anything but the human voice inside the church. And dancing- any kind of dancing, music, card playing-- well, it was very strict. They took up serpents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell Floyd these stories and he's horrified. They've always been Methodists, Floyd's family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're good people too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I married Floyd-- oh, it was quite a scandal among my relatives. As if I'd taken up with somebody in a cult.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can be a trial, married folks differ in their religion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And your husband is a--- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unaffiliated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unaffiliated. I see.    He has his-- social club-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Honeydripper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such a colorful name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He must devote a great deal of his energy to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just him and Maceo Green runs it, and then I go over and cook some when I get off here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's very- supportive of you. Considering the sort of- environment-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (defensive) I been in those barrooms most of my life, Miss Amanda. Amanda realizes she has probed too deep, tries to back up-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was a singer. I met Tyrone in the Paradise, down in Shreveport, China Doll was only two- Delilah considers, struggling to express who Ty is-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just kind of livin along, you know, drinking more than I ought-- then Tyrone. It was like a light come into my life. Delilah turns away, embarrassed to have revealed so much-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People think things because he owns the Lounge, but they don't know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small minds are never in short supply. She crosses to look out a window-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The people in this town--- She catches herself, smiles-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose they expected that Floyd, being from a prominent family- as prominent as is possible here in Harmony- would have chosen somebody more-- She fades away again, empties her glass-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My people were very devout, but they weren't- financially successful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No shame in that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In school, if you didn't have shoes- She frowns at the memory, sighs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I forgot-- Amanda is up and out of the room.   Delilah frowns at the decanter, hurries to put it away. Amanda comes back in holding a DRESS for a young girl-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was going through Emily's old things the other day, and I thought this would look just darling on your China Doll- Delilah examines the dress, which is clearly for a little girl-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh- I don't think it would near fit her, Miss Amanda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (disappointed) How old is she now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventeen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shocked) Oh my- I must have lost track somewhere along the line. Seventeen. She sits, still holding the dress, sneaks a look over to where the wine decanter was-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a very nice thought. An awkward silence that Perry Como fills inadequately. A KNOCK at the back door, then China Doll steps in, not seeing Amanda right away-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama?   They need you at- Delilah shifts her eyes to indicate-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry, Miss Amanda.   I didn't know you was home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) China Doll! We were just recalling-    you used to play right here under this table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 34   INT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM                            34 Ty sits staring, mind working overtime, staring at the dead woman on the bed. He barely hears Slick talking to the undertaker behind him, busy filling out forms-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There isn't any cash money I know of. She sold a good deal of the furniture, but there's still a nice- lookin sofa in the parlor. Only thing she cared for anymore was singin out to Pinetop's place- Ty looks at a large RING on Bertha's Mae's cold gray hand. He touches it with a finger-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You welcome to look around the house- if there's anything your Missus might like-- long as it's not something personal to me and Bertha Mae- Ty draws his finger away from the ring as if burnt-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just- she got to go out in style, is what it is. The best you got, all the trimmins- lay it out for her. That's the way she lived it- that's the way she ought to leave it. Ty closes his eyes and buries his head in his hands- 35   EXT. 1ST COTTON FIELD - AFTERNOON                            35 Blazing hot.    Cotton chaff in the air as the prison WORK GANG bend to their   task, dragging long sacks behind them like snakes. Even    the DEPUTIES are sweating rivulets as they stand by with   their SHOTGUNS in hand. Sonny is way behind the others, not dressed for the work, wincing as he pricks his fingers for the umpteenth time. NED, a little prisoner picking his way back in the opposite direction in a parallel row, takes pity on him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all never done this job before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't say I have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to set your pins out wide, bend over from the hip- Sonny widens his stance-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -and don't be bobbin up and down all the time. When you up, be up, but when you on the row, stay down. Sonny digs in and keeps low-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But most important, you got to get you a rhythm. Everything in this life got a rhythm to it- even pullin cotton off the plant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lay it out for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not my rhythm- your rhythm. That's between you and the day and the work you got before you. Once you on it, don't let nothin and nobody push you off it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going so slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gettin paid by the pound or by the hour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not gettin paid at all.   None of us are. Ned cackles-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I suggest you work that into your rhythm too. A DEPUTY calls out-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see more pickin and less talkin over there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gettin right on it, Boss! Ned picks his way behind Sonny. Sonny starts to rock slightly, looking for a rhythm of movement he can maintain- 36   EXT. 1ST OPPOSITE COTTON FIELD                            36 The free pickers sit on and around the truck that brought them, eating lunch. Dex watches the prison laborers across the road as he SHUFFLES a battered DECK OF CARDS, sitting with a couple of the other men-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Them boys fryin over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That Judge Gatlin's gang- he work them people from can until can't, ever damn day, and when his fields is picked he bid em out to the neighbors. Harvest time comes round here, you sign up with somebody fast or you stay outa sight. Dex waves flies away from his face, spits-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ate a peck of dust today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take some water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only thing wash the dust out is whiskey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) Aint enough whiskey in this world wash out what I swallowed in my life. Dex riffles the cards-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we playin for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two bits a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's kind of steep- Dex laughs and starts to deal a card at a time to the players-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I member playin this game one night- Memphis is Boss Crump's town, folks is gamblin before they can walk- ten dollars a hand. I caught a winnin streak that cleaned out half the sportin men on Beale Street. Got up from that table, my money was as long as train smoke-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happen to it? Dex raises his voice so the woman he checked out in the morning can hear-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spent it all on fine-lookin women. He calls to where Ham stands in knee-high grass, a heavy stick in his hand, staring intently at the ground-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, Missippi-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name Hamilton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hambone!   You want in on this? He raises a matchstick in his fingers-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Settle up on payday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That your deck of cards?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if it is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stay clear of it then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dex stops dealing to stare at Ham, insulted-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sinuatin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just sayin I don't want to play. There is a sudden RUSTLING at Ham's feet and WHAP! he brings his stick down hard. He pulls up a RABBIT, dead, by its hind legs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rabbit is a rodent. Man eat a rabbit, might's well eat a rat. Dex snorts, disgusted, then finishes dealing. He lays the top card face up and slaps down the rest of the deck-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mutters) Simple country nigger, fraid to sit down an lose his little handful of change--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He awful big to mess with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't scare me none. I'm a steppin razor, man, I'm trouble on two legs. We hear a CAR APPROACHING, SLOWING DOWN- DEX Your draw, Junebug. And don't be drippin sweat on my cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, folks- They turn to see Maceo leaning out of the window of Ty's old Ford, a Guitar Slim POSTER taped to the side of it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yall heard about the show we puttin on at the Honeydripper Saturday night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 37   EXT. PURVIS HOUSE - NIGHT                                    37 A very modest wooden house with a porch.    LIGHTS on inside- 38   INT. PURVIS HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT                          38 Ty and China Doll sit as Delilah lays dinner on the table. She is dressed to go out-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect there'll be a nice turnout for Bertha Mae tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Folks who wouldn't have nothin to do with her when she was alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of them, maybe. You still got to pay your respects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slick gonna have to find him a new ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a terrible thing to say-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how the man gets over, is all, sugarin up to some woman got a job or a bankroll-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no way to live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just how it is out in the world, baby- man got to walk through the gates of Hell to get a piece of cheese. He stares moodily, unnoticing as she lays his plate in front of him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not so young any more, lose hold of what little you got- He just shakes his head-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you lose the club I'm sure you'll find something else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this town?   Like what? Delilah proceeds cautiously-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know anytime you want I could get Miss Amanda to ask her husb-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Watch yo feet, Mr. Mayor, I done just mopped the flo! " Delilah tries to ignore this-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You work so hard at the Lounge, and what it brings in-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't even as much as what you make polishin that white lady's silver. I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't have to. Delilah gives up, knowing he's set on his mood-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll just have to work out, then. A strained silence.   Delilah crosses to the back door-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meetin gonna start without I'm there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your soul not the one needs savin, baby. She gives Ty a lost look, steps out.   The screen door slams. China Doll sees how worried Ty is-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all gonna be fine, Daddy. Everbody in town talkin bout Guitar Sam comin to Harmony. 39   EXT. REVIVAL TENT - NIGHT - WIDE SHOT                      39 A CHOIR sings at the front of the LANTERN-LIT tent, a CONGREGATION of salvation-seekers filling the benches-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother died- Yes she died and left me It was long- long time ago Oh but I searched Searched her record over I found mother just had to go UNDER TENT CHOIR Oh she cried son, Son don't you worry Oh you know the Lord Always fix a way Delilah arrives at the rear of the tent, finds herself a spot on a bench-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She left me standing Standing along the highway Oh wondering- which way I must go! REVEREND CUTLIP watches his singers, clapping out time with his big hands-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I walked- All along the highway I was seeking my Lord each day She left me standing Standing along the highway Just wondering- which way must I go! `Amens' and other sounds greet the end of the song. Reverend Cutlip steps to the center of the platform and looks around at the souls gathered-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Highway of Life, Brothers and Sisters, will twist you and turn you, it will run you this way and that way, it will tempt you with many a detour-- for the Highway of Life, Brothers and Sisters, is designed to lead us astray! He gets an `Amen!' from someone in the crowd-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It meanders away from the Light and into the Darkness, it tires our legs and whittles away at our spirits! The congregation start to get into it, RESPONDING, rocking with the rhythm of the sermon, flapping their PAPER FANS that advertise Beauchamp's Funeral Home in the hot night--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It snares us with the thorns and thistles of wickedness, it is paved with the black deeds of sinners and laid out on a crooked plan! That's not the road we want to be on, Brothers and Sisters, that's not the path we need to follow! The Reverend picks up speed-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got to get on that other road! The one that leads to salvation! The one that leads to glory! The one that leads to the right hand of God! Praise His name!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praise the Lord!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The thoroughfare I'm talking about, the righteous path we got to tread, is called the Highway to Heaven, and by the great Lord above it is straight and it is narrow! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep your eyes on the prize and your feet on the street and you won't ever make a mis-step, you won't ever falter, you won't ever stumble, because Jesus will show you the Way! Several people in the audience are up and SHOUTING now, getting into the Spirit. Reverend Cutlip shifts gear, filling his voice with a sense of dread and warning-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you got to pay attention to who it is walking beside you, Brothers and Sisters, got to be wary against those who will hold you back from your journey! There's many a loved one got to be left behind! Cause you either on the road or you lost in the wilderness! DELILAH We TIGHTEN on Delilah as she listens, upset, taking this all very personally-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You either headed for glory or doomed to damnation! You either in with the Lord or you in with the Devil- and they aint no in-between! 40   INT. JAIL - NIGHT                                           40 We TRACK past CELLS full of black PRISONERS- KING (O.S.) Tulsa aint so bad but for the smell-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got them stockyards near the jail-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right- and the flies. Course, I had me in a cell in Georgia once, six other men, didn't have no window atall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must of got caught on one a them freights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sonny is in a big COMMON CELL with the other conscripted LABOR GANG. He hangs on the bars as behind him men pitch pennies, while Ned and another veteran jailbird, KING, compare lodging experiences-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, aint no free ride allowed through Georgia. And the food there-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paltry-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paltry aint the word for it. Breakfast was a joke, lunch was a rumor-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -and dinner was a anecdote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) Spose you been locked in that box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or one just like it. Sonny begins to SING softly, almost to himself-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you wake up in the morning Hear the bing-bong ring- Walk up to the table And see the same damn thing All Imonna tell you Knife, a fork and a pan If you say a thing about it You're in trouble with the Man The men join him on the chorus-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let the Midnight Special Shine its light on me Oh let the Midnight Special Shine its ever-lovin light on me- Sonny turns to face them-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a singer, young man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Singer, guitar player- Imonna be on the radio some day. People gonna know my name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckles) Keep thinkin that way, young man. Judge Gatlin don't choose to work you into your grave, you just might do it. Sonny ponders this, looking back out through the bars, singing more moodily now as we TRACK AWAY from the cell-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you ever go to Houston Don't you stagger don't you fight Cause the Sheriff will arrest you You're in the cooler for the night-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 41   INT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE - BEDROOM - MORNING                    41 We hear the slow BLUES DIRGE Bertha May as we see China Doll applying polish to Bertha Mae's fingernails- 42   INT/EXT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE - MORNING                          42 MUSIC CONTINUES. We TRACK BACK through the house, looking at PHOTOGRAPHS and POSTERS of her singing in her glory days, finally TRACKING out onto the PORCH where Slick sits glumly on the steps and the undertaker stands in his black suit, looking at his watch as MOURNERS begin to pass into the house- 43   INT. BERTHA MAE'S HOUSE - PARLOR - MORNING                     43 MUSIC CONTINUES.   MOURNERS pass the OPEN COFFIN- 44   EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - MORNING                                    44 MUSIC CONTINUES. Ty and Maceo help carry the coffin down a dirt road, Slick walking at the head of the mourners following it- 68. 45   EXT. CEMETERY - MORNING                                      45 MUSIC CONTINUES as- Hands grip ropes as the coffin is lowered into the HOLE- Reverend Cutlip speaks a eulogy- Slick tries to keep it together- Scratch and Lonnie watch the ceremony from a tree branch- Ty looks at his watch, slips away from the funeral party. Delilah notices, frowns. Reverend Cutlip takes note as well- A shovel digs into piled dirt- Dirt is tossed down upon us and the screen goes BLACK. 46   EXT. RAILROAD STATION - MORNING                              46 Ty waits for a train, still in his mourning suit. We TIGHTEN on his face- tense, preoccupied with his schemes to save the club-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear tell Miss Bertha Mae passed. Ty whirls around-- somehow he didn't see Possum, sitting on a bench behind him, guitar in his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lived it how she sang it. Ty tries to ignore him, looks down the rails-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waitin for somebody. Ty is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aint nobody on that train gonna change your luck, Tyrone. Gonna have to save your own self.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (annoyed)    What you know about anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, nothin much. Ty steps away.    Possum speaks quietly-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I know you from way back. Possum starts PLAYING, a dark, moody, slide-guitar blues. Ty looks toward Possum, not happy he's there, then looks away. The MUSIC gets LOUDER, FASTER, Possum MOANING and WHOOPING, stomping his foot- We TIGHTEN on Ty's face, tighter, tighter, then DISSOLVE TO: INT. BAR - NIGHT - FLASHBACK 47                                                                47 We're in a   BAR ROOM- smoke, heat, packed bodies- Possum's SONG grows   more intense as we TRACK IN on GUITAR MAN- young, with slick   hair a moustache and tons of attitude. He sneers, flicks his   cigarette almost straight at us. We TRACK IN on YOUNG TYRONE, also swearing, stepping away from his piano- Guitar Man hands his guitar to one of the eager MEN standing close, hoping for a fight- A PRETTY GIRL stands to one side, looking scared and excited, covering her mouth with her hands- Young Tyrone steps in to meet him, the CROWD around almost pushing them together- Guitar Man pulls out a KNIFE! Young Tyrone grabs for it and they grapple, face to face, struggling in a terrible dance- A TRAIN WHISTLE breaks the spell! EXT. TRAIN YARD - MORNING - PRESENT 48                                                                48 Possum stops playing and cocks his head to listen- The WHISTLE again as the TRAIN APPROACHES. Ty takes a deep breath, hoping-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 49   EXT. COUNTRY ROAD/2ND COTTON FIELD - DAY                     49 Mourners are walking back down the country road where we saw the coffin carried. Reverend Cutlip sidles up to Delilah-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mournful end for a wayward sinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She always seemed at peace with herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The company she kept, the life she led-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never knew Bertha Mae to do hurt to a living soul. The Reverend is not too pleased with Delilah's forgiving attitude-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all hoping to see you get over and accept the Lord tonight, Delilah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm hoping so too. Cutlip nods toward the FIELD as they pass the PRISON LABOR GANG, picking cotton under guard-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been lingering at the threshold long enough, Sister. Time to step ahead. Delilah tries not to show how shaken she is by this challenge. She passes out of frame and we see China Doll bringing up the rear of the funeral party, lost in thought. She looks over into the cotton field- POV - SONNY, PRISON LABOR GANG Sonny bends his back with the other laborers, picking and sweating-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHINA DOLL China Doll pauses, frowns as she sees it is Sonny working, a DEPUTY strolling past him, shotgun in hand. Sonny sees her, lowers his head in shame- 50   EXT. TRAIN STATION - LATE MORNING                               50 The TRAIN has just pulled into the station.       A pair of PULLMAN PORTERS step out-- But nobody else. Ty feels his heart sink. Shack Thomas comes up behind him, carrying an overnight bag-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrone- got somebody gettin off here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Supposed to be. He halts by Ty for a moment, watching.      Nobody else is stepping out-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the party's name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam- Guitar Sam-- don't know his birth name-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (impressed) He's comin here? He calls to the porters further up the platform-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, Nat!    Guitar Sam get on this train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, man. He's in the hospital back in Little Rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hospital?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know music folks- whatever he was doin, he must have done too much of it. The porters LAUGH. Shack, realizing this must be a setback for Ty, pats his shoulder before he steps onto the train-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, brother- maybe he be in tomorrow. We FOLLOW Ty away from the train as Nat calls `All aboard!' and the engine gathers power. Possum sits listening to the single SLIDE NOTES he plays, as if tuning his guitar-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody didn't show up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grim) Wish they'd made you dumb instead of blind. We HOLD on Possum, cackling darkly, as Ty walks away.   The train WHISTLE BLOWS- 51   INT. HONEYDRIPPER - DAY                                       51 A torn and crumpled Guitar Sam POSTER lays on the bar counter. FINGERS move on the keyboard. Ty sits drinking, brooding, PLAYING and SINGING softly at the piano. Maceo is at the bar-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I had my fun if I Don't get well no more Well I had my fun if I Don't get well no more My head is spinnin And I'm goin down slow-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man don't take care of hisself- out drinkin and jazzin the women every night-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make any difference now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got so bad, I heard there was some ole boy goes around pretendin to be Guitar Sam, fill out the gigs he misses. Does pretty well for hisself, what I hear- Ty pauses on the keyboard-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody we could find?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Hell, I don't know.     Just a story I heard. They both go back to brooding.   Ty takes a drink.   He stares at the keyboard-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There must have been a first one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back slavery days, they had the ones that worked in the big house. Might not of had shoes always, but their pants didn't have no holes and they didn't pick no cotton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: House niggers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how they called em. They must of had all their African kinda instruments- drums, shakers, some kind of banjo thing- but the piano-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't bring no piano over on them ships from Africa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The piano was just sittin there in the white folks' big room, all polished up-- and I figure this one boy, he goes past fifteen, twenty times a day, running the corner of his eye over it. And he's there when they play, the masters, doin all their minuets and whatever- Ty PLAYS something like a MINUET- TY -him standing there with a tray of white people food pretendin not to have a thought in his head, might be only some dust hangin in the air for all they know- but he's watchin the fingers, see, watchin them keys work. This old boy, the first one, he can play alla them Africa kinda instruments, he can play mud if you give him the key and the tempo, he's got music in his head, in his heart, in every damn piece of him there's music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down to the bones--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And one day the masters is away, huntin foxes or some rich white people thing they get up to, and he's alone in the room with that piano and he comes over and sits down on the bench-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch out now-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -and he spreads his fingers out the way he seen the minuet player do- and he- Ty hits a MINOR CHORD, lets it decay-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he thinks- `Lord help me, I could do some damage with this.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A silence.    Maceo is moved by the scene-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would have liked to been there. I mean to hear the cat play, not none of the rest of it. Ty gets up and crosses the room with his drink in his hand, distraught. This is the end for Ty, no strategies left, nothing but the bitter taste of total defeat-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mace, Imonna lose my club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Man Toussaint finds out you stole his liquor, you like to lose more than that-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got no more cards to play-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe if you was to go down, see Lucky Hardaway in person-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry) I aint kissin up to no cokey-nose, conk-headed- WHAP! He kicks Sonny's guitar case, left sticking out under a table, and sends it spinning across the floor till it CRASHES into the bar and flips open. Ty and Maceo stare at the contents-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell that sposed to be? Maceo pulls out a home-built SOLID BODY GUITAR, a painted white rectangle with a complicated PICKUP jury-rigged over the strings and yards of ELECTRICAL CORD hanging off it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some kind of guitar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A guitar has got a hole in it, that's where the sound comes from. That boy must be bout three bricks shy of a load upstairs. China Doll rushes in, upset-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They gone and arrest him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arrested who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonny. The high Sheriff arrested him and sold him over to Judge Gatlin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Sonny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonny that was here yesterday morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonny that got a screw loose is why they arrested him. Maceo, make a noise on that- Maceo plucks a string.    Not much of a sound-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's electric-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I plug a chunk of stove wood into the wall I get more music out of it than that mess gonna make.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, man, it don't work unless it's hooked up to the juice, see? You got the juice, you don't need the hollow inside the box, the music just runs straight from the strings through this wire and comes out- He dumps the sack Sonny brought out and outs falls a mass of tubes and wires, also home-modified-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -your amplifier. Which is what this thing must be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonny said he fix radios in the Army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonny didn't do nothin but feed bedbugs in anybody's Army, and some of em crawled in his head. Surprised if that boy got the wit to pick cotton. Judge Gatlin bought himself a droolin idiot. What you want to amplify a damn guitar for anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Less you gonna sit over on your chair and play them little Charley Christian kind of riffs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sideman-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit over there and be all clean and polite. Guitar hasn't been up front since them old piss and moan blues shouters, sit their blind asses on the corner hollerin for pennies-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old time music-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy, Sonny didn't do nothin to be arrested for! He was just lookin for work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hung colored boys for less than that, darlin. Least on the work gang they feed em, keep their strength up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he doesn't belong there! Maceo turns the guitar over in his hands-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Guitar Sam plays him an electric, but I don't think it's this no-hole kind of deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope he plugs it in the wrong socket some night, lectrocutes his sorry no-show ass! Ty has a thought.    He looks over at the guitar in Maceo's hands-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (thinking out loud) Now if he did show up here-- and our power was to go out again while he was playing-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I fixed it good this time, Ty. Ty smiles-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he come out and plugs his ax in-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He come out lookin good, from what I hear. All kind of spangly pants and jacket, got his name spelled out on the back-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clothes, right-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hair all slick and shiny, flash some gold teeth at them gals, got his sax man behind him, maybe a piano, harmonica, drums-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember that night the lights went out in the Esquire Club in Mobile?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) And somebody took off with the gate? Stole the whole damn register off the counter-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They didn't hold it against Reggie Porter, did they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw- it was his place that got robbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't hold it against him, didn't expect no money back for the show-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all too busy diving on the pot of that tonk game got interrupted-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And nobody suspected it might be Reggie Porter hisself that pulled them lights, did they? Maceo begins to see where Ty is leading-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, no, Ty, we can't- Ty claps his hands together, jumps up and heads for the door-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: China Doll, you mind the place while we're gone! (to Maceo) Come on, man, we got work to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going, Daddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise the people Guitar Sam, they gonna get Guitar Sam! 52   INT. SHERIFF'S OFFICE                                     52 We start on a portrait of Governor Big Jim Folsom on the wall, then TILT DOWN to Sheriff Pugh, feet up on the desk, a table-top FAN pointed at him, looking up at Ty-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you interested in this boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a job for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be doin pretty good for yourself out there, Tyrone, you hirin new people on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Passing well, yeah-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this boy-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name is Sonny-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's payin off his debt to society right now, and if I was to pull him out of the field it would cost the county-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judge Gatlin payin three a day for prison labor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna pay me four for the duration of his sentence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which might be- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -as long as I care to make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I was counting on more of a one-time deal- if I could just rent him out for the weekend-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty dollars. Ty looks stricken-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not just the money. There's legalistic principles involved here. Public safety issues-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pay you Sunday morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You pay me now or you forget about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have it now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you too smart for the rest of us, don't you, Tyrone? Think you can go it by yourself. He puts his feet down and sits forward, drilling Ty with his eyes-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd rather eat roofin nails than come to me for a favor-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a favor if I got to pay-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you gonna pay all right. You don't hand me that money Sunday mornin, you got yourself a new partner. Same deal as I got with Toussaint. How'd that be? Ty considers.   He doesn't have any options-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (deadpan)    You'll get the fifty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles)    And that wife of yours-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wary)   Delilah-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Them fried chicken sandwiches- if I was to come by, now and then, check up on my interests-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She be happy to fix you whatever you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife's cookin would gag a maggot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Different people got different kinds of talents. Sheriff Pugh heaves himself to his feet-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lurleen aint discovered what hers is yet. Let's go fetch that boy. 53   EXT. 2ND COTTON FIELD - DAY - SHOTGUN                        53 A SHOTGUN in a deputy's arms- POV - PICKERS Faces dripping sweat, prison gang pickers stoop to their work- TY Ty stands by his beat-up old Ford at the side of the road, watching, remembering. A few of the PRISON LABORERS look up, curious, as Sonny is led over-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This the one? Ty nods, looks to Sonny-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got any ideas about turning rabbit on me, you best get rid of em now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You payin my way out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Till Monday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come? They get INTO THE CAR- TY You like draggin that cotton sack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then don't ask questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ty pulls away, leaving the less fortunate stooped in the field- 54   INT. SEWING ROOM - NADINE                                    54 MUSIC plays on the RADIO as Nadine masterfully works her SEWING MACHINE and Maceo stands by uneasily. He holds up the denim jacket Sonny left at the club-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This size, right, but it's got to shine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when you need this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (considers) That's a tall order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's got to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (fishing) You know, I do my best work, my fastest work, when I'm happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I spose you do- Nadine looks up at him from the sewing machine-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gone make me happy, baby? Maceo nervously makes for the door-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhm- you come by the club tonight, we havin a special show. Tell em at the door you my guest-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Food aint the only thing a woman needs three times a day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mutters) Wouldn't hurt you to skip a few meals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that, baby? Maceo turns at the open door-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy's gonna need time to try that jacket on- see how it feels. Later, Nadine- He is gone- 55   INT. HONEYDRIPPER - DAY                                   55 Ty and China Doll stand looking at Sonny as he sits on a bar stool-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to do somethin with this boy's head, darlin. They might not know what the real Sam look like, but it aint this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can try. China Doll looks through the beauty products she's piled up nearby-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what exactly I'm supposed to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gone stand up there with that contraption you got an play Guitar Sam numbers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I do that with my eyes closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could get the audience to close theirs we be better off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ty- Maceo pops his head in the front door-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tracked Mr. Trenier down-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hit it. Ty leaves to join Maceo-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye, Daddy. China Doll is a little nervous to be left alone with Sonny. She puts her comb in her hand and walks around Sonny, examining his hair while he examines her face-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what you're doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fix Mama's hair all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you aint been to that school yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go to school to learn your guitar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs)   No. China Doll steps behind the bar-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I might pick up some new things at beauty school but mostly it's for my certificate, and that is `a ticket to adventure'- that's what it says in the brochure. People lookin for beauty all over the world. Sonny sees the LOOSE WIRES that come through the wall behind the bar. China Doll searches around-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to watch out for them wires sticking down- don't look safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Yeah- power's always going out, people getting shocks and whatnot-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody ought to fix it. She searches under the counter for something-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `A career in beauty is like money in the bank.' Says that in the brochure too. Plus it isn't physically taxin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I can't see no pretty thing like you behind a plow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had the rheumatic fever when I was little, left me with a weak heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Mine been actin funny too- since I laid eyes on you. She acknowledges his flirting with a little smile and comes up with a MASON JAR full of clear LIQUID- SONNY What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just some ole moonshine they keep around. China Doll crosses back to Sonny-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (concerned) What you gonna do with it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They always joke about how this stuff'll straighten your hair right out- She twists the lid off, sniffs the liquid, reacts to its strength-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imonna just make yours relax a little. 56   INT. PARLOR                                               56 TIME TRENIER, an older musician with a permanently stoic expression, sits watching his pupil, a YOUNG BOY, torture the SCALES with a CORNET. He glances up at Ty and Maceo, trying not to plug their ears as the boy continues to PLAY- MACEO Mr. Time Trenier- that's a name to be reckoned with. Time doesn't seem to react to the flattery-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Story goes that you used to play with Buddy Bolden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Played with most all of em down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And King Oliver-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One band falls apart you find yourself another one. Never any shortage of bands, down New Awlins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know you was givin lessons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pays the rent.   Almost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You interested in a playin job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your place?
direction.name: direction
