direction.raw_text: (tentative) It's uhm- backin up a man on the electric guitar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs)     If you can pay, I can play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to dress sharp. No need to say this to Time Trenier.       You could cut yourself on the creases on his pants-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It aint like a all-night thing- you just start out and there's gonna be a accident- Ty shoots Maceo a look-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sudden loss of power.      Lights out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs again)      It's your gig, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight o'clock. This aint colored people time and it sure aint New Awlins time. I mean eight o'clock on the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you got the green I'm on the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a deal then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know any drummers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods)     I'll bring you one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothin fancy, he just got to keep time-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time is my name. Ty and Maceo wince as the kid hits a particularly SOUR NOTE- 89. 57   EXT. COUNTRY ROAD, 2ND COTTON FIELD - LATE AFTERNOON        57 The free pickers are lined up at the side of the road- CLOSER A white CLERK sits behind a wooden table in front of the transport truck and pulls cash from a METAL BOX, consulting a thick LEDGER in front of him as he pays the pickers off. Sheriff Pugh observes, his patrol car parked nearby. Ham has come to the head of the line, Junebug behind him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenny-four, twenny-five, twenny- six, twenny-seven, twenny-eight. Make your mark here-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly)   Owe me thirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Book says twenny-eight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dollar fifty every hundred pound, and I picked-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two dollars deducted for stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't put no stones in the sack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We mill the cotton, there's always stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there wasn't none in my sack-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We take off two dollars a week, always have. Aint that right, Junebug? Junebug knows it's useless to complain-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes suh.   Been that way my whole life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ham is furious but has nowhere to go with it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna take your pay, son, or give it up to charity? Ham swipes his pay off the table, stalks away.    Sheriff Pugh glares after him. We FOLLOW Ham as he crosses to the rear of the truck.    Dex sits on the tailgate, grinning at him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't let nobody mess with my money like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They took the same two dollars off yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and you could pave a highway with the rocks I threw in that mess. He catches the eye of Lucille, standing nearby-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You country nigros let the crackers run you like dogs- SNATCH! Ham grabs Dex by the shirt front and yanks him close, hissing in fury-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sheriff wasn't here I'd snap your neck, boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let me stop you. Ham turns to see Sheriff Pugh standing behind him, a wry smile on his face-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But first you gonna sign that ledger like you sposed to. Don't want nobody cryin they didn't get their due.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 58   INT. HONEYDRIPPER - DAY                                      58 Ty is repairing the little STAGE with hammer and nails-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Purvis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (doesn't look up) People call me Ty or they call me Pinetop. Mr. Pinetop to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wanted to tell you- I preciate the opportunity. Ty looks up to see Sonny with his hair pressed under a tight cap made from an old STOCKING- TY Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know ever one of Guitar Sam's songs- know the chords, know the words-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's fine. Sonny begins to stroll around the edge of the club, looking at PHOTOS and SHOWBILLS on the walls-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: China Doll said how you was famous once. Ty is pleased at his step-daughter's bragging, but doesn't show it-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was known, but I was never what you call famous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get your start? Ty sighs, sits back from his work-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down in Mobile there was an old cathouse professor name of Joe Dudlow, had had a stroke on one side, curled him all up- but he kept on pluggin. I used to come out and play his left hand for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old you were?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Thirteen, fourteen. This one night it was goin hot and heavy and Joe just passed, right there at the piano, in the middle of Black Bottom Stomp. They propped him up at the bar, stuck a drink in his hand, and told me to keep poundin them ivories. (shakes his head) There was a meanness hanging over them juke joints, there was murder in the air. You stopped playin for a minute, it come down like a flock of crows. Sonny stops by a poster for the `REGINALD ERSKINE BAND featuring Tyrone "Pinetop" Purvis'-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is you-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big band days, on the road. If a railroad train run through it, we played it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) `Reginald Erskine'. Don't believe I ever heard of him-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big tall light-skin fella out of Carolina, said he's part Cherokee. Couldn't play nothin, but he waved his little stick and had this long greasy hair he throw around like Cab Calloway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you were the piano man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piano man, arranger, you name it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That must of been somethin, see the country first class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know about first class, but we seen the country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you stopped?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Got tired of carrying another man's water. Didn't want to die in no colored hotel some night in Who-Knows-Where Arkansas. He bangs the last nail in-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Met Delilah and wanted something of my own.

direction.raw_text: Oh China Doll Got to let you into my heart! Oh China Doll Got to let you into my heart! I surrender darlin I loved you from the very start! Ty rushes to the piano, joins in jamming with the other players- 76   EXT. CEMETERY - NIGHT                                         76 Slick sits on a tomb, drinking wine, MOONLIGHT spilling over Bertha Mae's fresh-dug GRAVE. He listens to the MUSIC in the far distance-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sound like the music movin on again, darlin. The way it always do. He listens for another moment, sighs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time to make room for whoever comin next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 77   EXT. HONEYDRIPPER - MORNING                                  77 The SUN RISES next to the Honeydripper sign. We hear the CROW of a distant ROOSTER. The parking lot is empty but for Ty's old Ford- Ty, exhausted but happy, steps out front. He pastes a SNIPE that says HELD OVER! across the Guitar Sam poster-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That boy can play some. Ty turns. Possum is on the road, guitar strung over his shoulder, feeling his way with a red-tipped CANE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You leavin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aint needed round here no more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you headed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles)     Oh-- down the road. Ty watches the blind man move away for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrone- Ty turns as Maceo steps out, equally tired and unshaven-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who you talkin to out here? Maceo looks down the road, but Possum is nowhere to be seen. Ty shrugs-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just myself. 78   EXT. SHARECROPPER SHACK - EARLY MORNING                      78 Scratch and Lonnie are set to pretend to play music again. Lonnie spreads his fingers over the keys he's drawn on the board- -and begins to PLAY!    Fast, rhythmic boogie piano-
direction.name: direction
